credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 64.6 x 64 cm (25 7/16 x 25 3/16 in.)
title: Sample
medium:
Medium: cotton, linen, metallic
Technique: bands of plain weave alternating with bands of gauze weave
description: Hand-woven sample for a casement fabric in uneven vertical stripes of white and tan with silver metallic effects.  The weft is of undyed linen throughout.  The white stripes have a white cotton warp; the weft alternates a single yarn with a group of three, interlaced in gauze weave.  The darker stripes have tan cotton warps alternating with silver-colored metallic strips; the wefts are handled singly and interlaced in plain weave.
name: Sample
